title: Jimmy Dean Breakfast Casserole Recipe
description: This breakfast casserole with bread, sausage, eggs, cheese, tomatoes, mushrooms, and onion is a hearty, all-in-one breakfast dish that's easy to make.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips Jimmy Dean Jimmy Dean Breakfast Casserole 4.6 (361) 271 Reviews 76 Photos This breakfast casserole with bread, sausage, eggs, and cheese makes breakfast a breeze. It's an all-in-one breakfast casserole that may be assembled and refrigerated up to 12 hours before baking. The tomatoes and mushrooms are optional. Submitted by JimmyDean Updated on November 19, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 76 76 76 76 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 5 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 1 9x13-inch casserole Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings cooking spray 1 (16 ounce) package Regular Flavor Jimmy Dean Pork Sausage 10 large eggs, lightly beaten 3 cups milk 2 teaspoons dry mustard 1 teaspoon salt 6 cups cubed bread 2 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese 1 medium tomato, seeded and chopped ½ cup sliced mushrooms ½ cup thin-sliced green onion ½ teaspoon black pepper Directions Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Cook sausage in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until thoroughly cooked and no longer pink, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine eggs, milk, dry mustard, and salt in a large bowl; stir well. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Distribute 1/2 of the bread evenly into the prepared dish. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the sausage, 1/2 of the cheese, 1/2 of the tomato, 1/2 of the mushroom, 1/2 of the green onion, and 1/2 of the black pepper. Repeat layers one more time. Pour egg mixture evenly over casserole. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake uncovered until eggs are set, 55 to 60 minutes. Tent with foil if the top begins to brown too quickly. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Notes Time-saving tip: One 9.6-ounce package of fully cooked Jimmy Dean Hearty Sausage Crumbles may be substituted for one 16-ounce package of fresh breakfast sausage in most dishes. I Made It Print 844 home cooks made it! Turned out great. 06 of 76 Photo by  Joey 01/10/2021 Good recipe, I used 1lbs of sausage with a smoked sausage cut into pieces with a can of rotel. Turned out great. 07 of 76 Photo by  Jamie Z 01/09/2021 08 of 76 Photo by  Mrs Hoefy 09/06/2020 09 of 76 Photo by  Mrs Hoefy 09/06/2020 10 of 76 Photo by  Lisarieger 07/19/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Nana's Green Chile Make-Ahead Breakfast Casserole 11 Ratings Super Easy Breakfast Sausage Loaf 6 Ratings Slow Cooker Egg Casserole 1 Rating Hearty Breakfast Casserole 520 Ratings Overnight Bacon Brunch Casserole 7 Ratings Loaded Overnight Breakfast Casserole 2 Ratings Italian Breakfast Bread Pudding 2 Ratings Sausage Tater Tot Breakfast Casserole 377 Ratings Breakfast Strata 66 Ratings Jimmy Dean Hearty Sausage Mini Quiches 48 Ratings Make Ahead Breakfast Casserole 399 Ratings Susie's Breakfast Casserole 40 Ratings Jimmy Dean Sausage Breakfast Pizza 27 Ratings Slow Cooker Breakfast Casserole 22 Ratings Father's Day Casserole 33 Ratings Egg and Hash Brown Casserole 87 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
